definition: not to accept sth/to want to have sth overruled or changed/to refuse to obey or comply/to refuse to accept as final/to remain unconvinced by/not to give in to
(negative prefix)/not/no
classifier for medicine: dose/Taiwan pr. [fu2]

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes
not acclimatized
(of a stranger) not accustomed to the climate of a new place/not acclimatized
to deny a crime/to plead not guilty
not be accustomed to eating sth/not be used to certain food
coercion will never convince (idiom)

sentences.english: A transferee who is dissatisfied with such an order may apply for review not more than once.
sentences.chinese: 受让人对裁定不服的，可以申请复议一次。

sentences.english: At that time, England was in a Bible war between two English translations.
sentences.chinese: 当时，英国有两版英译《圣经》，互相不服气。

sentences.english: Rabbit and refuses to obey, and race results ranked in the dragon's front.
sentences.chinese: 兔子又不服，和龙赛跑，结果排在了龙的前面。

sentences.english: The plaintiff battled the decision all the way to the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 原告不服这项判决，上诉直到最高法院。

sentences.english: My dear boy, I have no idea. This is, as they say, your party.
sentences.chinese: “那你认为我们是在哪儿呢？”哈利有点不服气地说。

sentences.english: After the first instance verdict, Lin appealed to the Nanjing intermediate court.
sentences.chinese: 一审判决后，林某不服上诉至南京市中级法院。

sentences.english: Despite his insubordination, Dofine remained in command of the blockade's forces.
sentences.chinese: 虽然不服管，但多法因依然指挥着封锁部队。

sentences.english: Mr. Bruce pleaded not guilty on his client’s behalf, and Mr. Jiang spoke only two words. Did he understand the charges?
sentences.chinese: 布鲁斯律师表示不服，而江先生只说了两个字。

sentences.english: The country not agreeing with her, she returned to England.
sentences.chinese: 她杂阿谁国度不服水土，所以回到了英国。

sentences.english: Dezun Company refused to accept and appealed to Sichuan Higher People's Court.
sentences.chinese: 德润公司不服，向四川省高级人民法院提起上诉。

sentences.english: The control group refused to use Chinese medicine, and use Oxytocin and Antibiotics to treat.
sentences.chinese: 对照组不服中药，加用宫缩素及抗菌素治疗。

sentences.english: Come on, it's because I just arrived and haven't acclimated yet.
sentences.chinese: 哪儿能啊，我只是刚来有点儿水土不服罢了。

sentences.english: Neither of them could convince the other.
If you do not accept the decition of reexamination. you can take further step of suit.
sentences.chinese: 只有对复议决定不服的才可以起诉。

sentences.english: For whatever reason, something about the Australian Open seems to disagree with Venus.
sentences.chinese: 不知为何，大威对澳网似乎变现得有些“水土不服”。

sentences.english: Huixin company subsequently appealed against the verdict.
sentences.chinese: 随后慧信公司不服，提出上诉。

definition: to be convinced/to accept
ruling/adjudication
to accept wholeheartedly/to embrace/to be won over
judgment (by a court of law)/to pass judgment on/to sentence
unsatisfied/unconvinced/indignant
to admit defeat/to give in/to acknowledge a mistake/to apologize/to be amenable to persuasion
innocent/guileless/not guilty (of crime)
resentful/discontented/dissatisfied
to have nothing to say (idiom)
to speak conceited nonsense/to come out with arrogant claptrap
to bare one shoulder/(fig.) to side with/to discriminate in favor of
firm/unyielding/strong-willed
to signal the musicians (in Chinese opera, by prolonging a spoken word before attacking a song)/(coll.) to challenge
cannot bear to see/to hate/to dislike/to disapprove
to act shamelessly/to refuse to acknowledge that one has lost the game, or made a promise etc/to act dumb/to act as if sth never happened
reasonable/justified/right/(math.) rational
